intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. muonioensis, commonly known as the Muonio buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern Europe. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in mountainous regions. Its leaves are palmately divided with a hairy surface, and it has a short, stout rhizome. This subspecies is relatively rare and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
